title: `http_archive` does not consider integrity of remote files/patches when setting `reproducible = True`

labels.name: P1
labels.description: I'll work on this now. (Assignee required)

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Someone outside the Bazel team could own this

body:
### Description of the bug:


`http_archive` repository rule currently allows integrity of remote files/patches to be unset, but does not consider this when returning `ctx.repo_metadata(reproducible = True)`. When repository contents cache is enabled, this can result in mismatched content.

At the same time, no message (like `canonical reproducible form can be obtained by`) is shown when these integrity values are absent.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

External Dependency

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


1. Create a file with some data (`file://` will be used for simplicity):
   ```shell
   $ cat /path/to/test.txt
   some data
   ```

2. `MODULE.bazel` (the archive itself is irrelevant):
   ```bazel
   module(name = "mymodule")

   http_archive = use_repo_rule("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
   http_archive(
       name = "myrepo",
       url = "URL of any archive",
       integrity = "integrity of the archive",
       remote_file_urls = {
           "test.txt": ["file:///path/to/test.txt"],
       },
   )
   ```

3. Fetch `myrepo`:
   ```shell
   $ bazel query @myrepo//...
   $ cat "$(bazel info output_base)"/external/*myrepo*/test.txt
   some data
   ```

4. Change `test.txt`:
   ```shell
   $ cat /path/to/test.txt
   other data
   ```

5. Clean and re-run Bazel:
   ```shell
   $ bazel clean --expunge && rm MODULE.bazel.lock
   $ bazel query @myrepo//...
   $ cat "$(bazel info output_base)"/external/*myrepo*/test.txt
   some data
   ```
   But the content should be `other data`.

When repository contents cache is disabled, output is as expected:
```shell
$ cat /path/to/test.txt
some data
$ bazel query --repo_contents_cache= @myrepo//...
$ cat "$(bazel info output_base)"/external/*myrepo*/test.txt
some data

$ cat /path/to/test.txt
other data
$ bazel clean --expunge && rm MODULE.bazel.lock
$ bazel query --repo_contents_cache= @myrepo//...
$ cat "$(bazel info output_base)"/external/*myrepo*/test.txt
other data
```

The same thing is applicable to remote patches - while they require an integrity string to be set, it can be set to an empty string, which disables integrity check in `repository_ctx.download()`.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Ubuntu 22.04

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.3.1

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

Expected unset integrity of remote files/patches to be either an error or correctly accounted for when returning `reproducible = True`.
